intro: Retinaria scandens, commonly known as the climbing retinaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough texture. Retinaria scandens is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and ability to climb structures.
